turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: It's still a good plan.  It's just... got a twist.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Yeah.  Kidnapping.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Not if we keep 'em here.  You can't kidnap somebody in their own house. It's just breaking and entering, unless we take 'em someplace.  Or something like that, I'm pretty sure.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Pure idiot.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: I am.  I'm an idiot's son.  An idiot's grandson.  I'm third- generation idiot.  But for once in my life I had a good idea, and I'm not giving up so easy.  You are? Are you actually telling me that for the first time in your life you're gonna throw your cards on the table and go home early?  I can't believe my eyes.  Fourteen million dollars upstairs, Burnham.  You'll be out of the hole. Baby, you'll be so far out of the hole you could draw bricks every night for the next twenty years and still shit green.  Come on, Buddy.  One more hand.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Got her right where you want her, Junior.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: When you said you'd let 'em go I thought she'd come running right out for sure.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Shut up and let me think.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: I'm afraid to let you think, Junior. Things get worse when you think.  Oh, that's gonna help.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Okay, fuckball, you think.  What are we gonna do?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: She said she did.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: She lied.  Cops woulda been here by now if she called 'em.  Besides, Junior cut the phones.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Yes.  Yes, it's all terrible ironic and amusing.  You fuck.  Now how are you gonna get us into that room?

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Can't.  Whole point.  Can't get in the room.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Open it.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: I did.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Be quiet.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: We're trying to scare them, not kill them!

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: They're coughing.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: They're gonna die in there!

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Nobody is gonna die, man, will you please have the balls to follow through with a good idea?  Think about it, what would you do if you were them, stay in there and choke to death, or come out?!  Huh?  We're just getting them to come out for forty-five minutes, forty-five fucking minutes!  The worst that's gonna happen is they pass out, we drag 'em out here into the fresh air, and they'll be fine.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Junior, you gigantic idiot, how are we supposed to get into the room if they pass out?

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Cell phone.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: She's never coming out.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: And we're never getting in.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Do me a favor and don't talk.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Jesus, what was I thinking?

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Hey man, after all we went through I am not walking out when we're this close.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Close?  Are you insane?  We're nowhere near close!  Fuck this, I'll make an anonymous phone call on Monday, they'll find the floor safe, and I'll inherit the shit.  Little piece of it, anyway, it's better than nothing.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: What about us?

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: We're not leaving.  I'm getting in that room, and I'm opening that safe.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Lookin' doubtful there, Big Guy, but ten out of ten for attitude.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: You walk out that door and you lose your share of the money.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Yeah, whatever.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: I mean it!

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Adios.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: COP 1
turns.text: Everything okay?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: COP 1
turns.text: 'Bout four o'clock.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: I don't get it.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Somebody called you?

turns.speaker: COP 1
turns.text: Can we come in?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: COP 1
turns.text: We'd like to come in.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: No, you can't come in.

turns.speaker: COP 1
turns.text: Can we come in?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Stop asking me that.  I'm fine.  Who called you?

turns.speaker: COP 1
turns.text: You don't look so good.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: You wake me out of a sound sleep at four in the morning and then tell me I look like hell?  Of course I look like hell, you don't look so hot yourself, Jack.  I'm freezing here, thank you for checking, can I go?

turns.speaker: COP 1
turns.text: Your husband says you said "There are three..." right before you got cut off.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Oh, that phone call...

turns.speaker: COP 1
turns.text: May I ask what the rest of that sentence was going to be?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: COP 1
turns.text: The sentence that started "There are three."  What was the rest?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: One day you will learn to respect other people's time, Lydia, one day you --

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Evan, I am so sorry, you were a saint to wait for us!

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I don't have to tell you there is an acute shortage of living space in Manhattan right now and this is a highly unique property.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: No ball, kid.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Third floor, spare bedroom, den, what have you.  Mr. Pearlstine used it as an office.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: He's talking about Bernard Pearlstine.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Master bath.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: The hotel guy?  It's been in the papers lately.  His kids are all suing each other over his estate. He was a total recluse, paranoid, rich as hell, he was worth thirty million or something, now it turns out they can't find half of it.  Somebody took something didn't belong to them!

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I hardly see how family gossip is germane to showing the property.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Stop calling it the property, you sound ridiculous.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Master closet.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Could the child please stop that?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: KID!  NO ELEVATOR!

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Oh, I've seen these...

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: It's quite in vogue in high end construction right now.  One really can't be too careful about home invasion.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Hey, this is perfect for you...  Absolutely!  You're a woman, you're living alone now.  Your alarm goes off, or you head glass break, or for whatever reason you think someone's broken into your home in the middle of the night.  What are you going to do?  Call the police and wait until they get here on Tuesday?  Traipse downstairs in your sexy little underthings and check it out?  I think not!

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Reinforced steel core walls.  Buried phone line, completely separate, not connected to the house's main line and never exposed throughout the house's infrastructure or outside the house -- you can call the police; nobody can cut you off. Your own ventilation system, complete with oxygen scrubber, so you've got plenty of fresh air for as long as you like.  And a bank of video monitors --

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: That door is a safely hazard.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Not at all.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Working elevator.  Mr. Pearlstine, the previous owner, was disabled the last ten years of his life.  Highly unusual, the elevator, you will not find this in ninety percent of brownstones.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Will they take asking price?  I need a two week escrow and I'm already approved for the loan.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: A safe room.  An inner sanctum.  A castle keep, in medieval times.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Everything's spring-loaded, even if the power's out it's fully functional.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Open it.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: That's highly inappropriate.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: I said open the door.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Push that button for me, will you?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Don't!

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Watch your mouth.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: It's okay, Raoul.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Wait a minute, wait a minute.  We can still handle this.  Can we still handle this?

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: It's just the woman and the kid?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Cut it back a little bit.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: No fucking way.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: He's right, we can't get into the room if they're dead!

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: We're not gonna do anything about him, he's fine.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: If you think I'm gonna let my half of the fourteen million bucks slip away because of --

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: "Half?"  What did you, take a nap in math class?  Three people, three shares, one third.  Four point six six six repeating.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: I'm just saying, the man is a problem.  And he's your problem. Wasn't me idea to bring him along.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: That's right, Raoul, it wasn't your idea, none of this was your idea, it was mine, it's my family we're ripping off, it's my prick grandfather who built that fucking room, it was my idea to get the plans, I found the floor safe, and it was my idea to ask a guy who builds these rooms to help break into one!  Me, me, me, I, I, I, at no point did I say "you" or Raoul," got it?

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: He puts his hands on me again I'll bury a slug in his ear.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: No, you will not, because without Burnham there's no way in hell we're gonna get into that safe, so as far as I'm concerned he can paint your ass blue and run it up a flagpole and you won't lay a finger on him, you understand me?

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Don't take no tone of voice with me, Homes.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: What is this shit you're talking all of a sudden?  You're a bus driver, "Homes," you live in Flatbush, so please don't start spouting some Elmore Leonard shit you just heard because I saw that movie too,

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: We're leaving.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: The hell we are.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Suit yourself.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Nobody leaves.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Observe.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: -- seventeen feet wide, fifty-five feet deep, forty-two hundred square feet, four floors with a rentable basement apartment, so five altogether, courtyard in back --

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Could you slow down a little?  Or we could wait for the car...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: No cars.  Feet are faster.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: How many more do we have after this?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: None, there's nothing else, you know how tight the market is.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: This is it?  I told you on the phone, I have to be moved in in two weeks.  Sarah, please don't bounce that here.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Something's weird.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: I don't know, doesn't that corner seem funny to you?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Makes me nervous.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Ever read any Poe?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I don't think so, but I love her album.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: No, Edgar Allen.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: The furniture guy?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: What's to keep them from prying open the door?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Old Bernie didn't miss a trick with this room, did he?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Open the door.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: And with kids like he's got, no wonder he wanted a place to hide.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Too many stairs.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Got us in here, didn't I?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Shoulda got an apartment.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Well, I know that now.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: The phone works.  Hey, I hooked up the phone.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: The crowd goes wild.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Fuck him.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Don't.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Fuck her too.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What's going on?!

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: People.  In the house.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: He's going down.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: That room!

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: PANIC ROOM!

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Damn it!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: It doesn't work?!

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Different phone line, I never hooked it up!

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Can't hear a thing.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What do they want?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: I don't know.  Rob us.  I don't know.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What do we do?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Wait.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What if they get in here?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: They can't.  They can't get in here. No.  They can't.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I heard you.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Feel okay?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Shaky?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Chills?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Huh uh.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: "What we want is in that room."

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: They're coming in here, aren't they?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: No, I told you, they can't.  It's not a possibility.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: We're not coming out.  We're not letting you in.  Get out of my house.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Say fuck.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Fuck.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: "Get the fuck out of my house."

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Get the fuck out of my house!

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Oh, please.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Give me a break.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Are you freaking out?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Little bit.  Yeah.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Small space?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Don't though.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Why did the chicken cross the road?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: What am I, a five year old?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Why did the chicken cross the road?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: I don't know, why?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: To prove he wasn't chicken.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: YOU CAN'T DO THAT!  YOU CAN'T FREAK OUT LIKE THAT!  YOU HAVE TO STAY HERE WITH ME!

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: I am.  I'm here.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: YOU HAVE TO!

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: I'm here.  I'm here.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What, what, what is it?!

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: On the floor!  Get on the floor!

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Morse code?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Dot dot dot, dash dash dash, dot dot dot.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Where'd you learn S.O.S.?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: "Titanic."

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Got him!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Come on, come on...

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: We're never getting out of here.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Shhh...

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Do it.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Yeah, but where's the third guy?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Not in the bedroom.  Do it!

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: If it looks like I can't get back, just close the door.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Close it!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: I saw something, I saw...

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Strip 'em, expose the ends, try blue first, blue is phones!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Blue is phones?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Yes, no, I don't know, do 'em all!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Call Dad!

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: On it!

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: He'll do something.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Uh uh.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: He'll know we're in trouble.  He heard me, I said "There are three..."

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: He won't even know who it was.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: What would you think, in the middle of the night?  I mean, three what, three bears?  He'll call the police.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Stop it.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: He's just across the park, this is why we got places so close to each other, in case we needed each other, we're still a family, he'll help us...

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: He --

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: He WILL.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I was trying not to tell you...

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I'm dizzy and thirsty.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Okay, listen, honey, you went double digit here, you must have been shooting out adrenaline like crazy, we gotta bring your blood sugar back up, okay?  Can you hear me?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I'm dizzy, not deaf.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Hey, she's still a smart ass, excellent sign.  Did you see any sugar in here?  Any candy bars, anything sweet?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Huh uh.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Okay, you just gotta calm yourself down, that's all, just stay calm and your adrenaline will go back to normal and you'll be fine.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What if I keep dropping?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Not an option.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What if I do?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What if I spazz out?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: No biggie, we've been through it a dozen times, I just jab you with the Glucogen.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Where is the Glucogen?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Oh, you know, it's uh... it's in the little fridge in your room.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I'm sorry, Mom.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Hey, quit apologizing, you're starting to sound like Grandma. You're not gonna have an attack. Okay?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Alma!? I uhh I don't think...

turns.speaker: ALMA
turns.text: What do you mean? We're black ain't we? And we care about improving the plight of out people don't we? Or you figure oppression stops at that thing dangling between your legs!

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Uhh... I with it sister but...

turns.speaker: ALMA
turns.text: But nothing, we want full fledged membership in the Black Panther Party... and none of this "Okay sugah as long as you stay in the background washing my socks and rubbing my feet" bullshit either!

turns.speaker: ALMA
turns.text: Little Bobby... Just a kid...

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: They're hurting us, baby. Huey locked up. Bobby Seale running all over the country holding things together. Cy dead. Little Bobby... I don't recognize half the faces at meetings.

turns.speaker: ALMA
turns.text: Tyrone...

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Oh shit Alma... you're...

turns.speaker: ALMA
turns.text: I'm okay... listen to me...  Let's go with Judge, check it out.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: What?!? Don't tell me you're buying this?

turns.speaker: ALMA
turns.text: Those ain't cops.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: And they sure ain't from the neighborhood. Figure Sabu's in there?

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Alma I told you to...

turns.speaker: ALMA
turns.text: Fuck that, we've got company...

turns.speaker: ALMA
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: You gotta. You gotta stay alive. You know what they were trying to do here. You got the pigs dead to rights. It's like Huey said, you're more important than any of us.

turns.speaker: BEEFY COP
turns.text: Okay now, er, Huey, so what's your telephone number?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: I have confirmed to you my address, that's all I'm required to by law to do. We have broken no law.

turns.speaker: BEEFY COP
turns.text: What are you doing with the gun?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: What are doing with yours?.

turns.speaker: BEEFY COP
turns.text: Lemme see that rifle son...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: No! This is my private property. According to California law we have a constitutional right to bear arms.

turns.speaker: BEEFY COP
turns.text: Well... is it loaded?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: I tell you "officer", it wasn't...

turns.speaker: BEEFY COP
turns.text: For the last time Boy!!! What do those guns mean??!!

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: They mean, Pig!, that the Black Panther Party declares that if you try to brutalize our community or take our weapons.  We are going to shoot you!!!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Free? We're back where we started. Shit we still don't have a stop light.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Well as the Rev says, God helps those who help themselves.  We'll be our own stoplight.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well if anyone's gonna protect Malcolm's legacy it better be us.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Damn straight...  Let's go check out these Paper Panthers.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: This brothers is gonna be a colossal event. We'll shut the mother down right at the capitol, in front of the cameras.  Will you cool it? What's up man? What it be Bobby?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What it be is, You aren't coming with us.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: What? We're the leadership, you and me. There ain't enough of us to...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's just it Huey. The pigs don't know how many Panthers there are. Both of us show and they might start putting 2 and 2 together. We're not even two hundred strong yet... but we got 'em guessing thousands.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: I hear you. Alright. I'll go, you stay.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You got six months to donate to the party, Bobby?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You know it brother.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You got to sit on Eldridge...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Man, El-Rage is El-Rage. You know him.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Yeah, I do, but he's gotta cool it...

turns.speaker: BOBBY SEALE
turns.text: Huey!! Man you gotta check this out... You're gonna love...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Hold up a second... We got a decision to make.

turns.speaker: BOBBY SEALE
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Dig it, you know those brothers over in San Fran... call themselves the Black Panthers too?

turns.speaker: BOBBY SEALE
turns.text: Sure, those boojie jokers don't do anything except print up a lotta paper saying "Black is Beautiful."

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: ...The police report says he was shot three times but the coroner's report says quite clearly that Denzil Dowell was shot six times. And two of those shots were in his armpits. Brothers and Sisters you know why that is?  Because Denzil had his hands up!!

turns.speaker: BOBBY SEALE
turns.text: No more police brutality! WHAT DO WE WANT?

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Yeah... Sounds like the Constitution to me. With a little of the Bill of Rights thrown in...

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: Inspector Brimmer, this is no joke During your surveillance have you seen any outside agitators? Professorial types? Communists?

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: No. I've seen Black men handing out bags of food. Having meetings. Patrolling the neighborhood. Having more meetings. They ain't...

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: They are carrying guns. They are threatening police officers. They are undermining the United States of America. And you Inspector Brimmer are not taking your duties seriously...

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Like?

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: Like, you Inspector Brimmer are not going to be sitting in your car anymore. I think it's time for a more active type of involvement.

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: What the fuck?

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: Brimmer! Could you come in here please?

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: Sit down, This concerns you too.  I don't need to say that your department's handling of the Black Panthers -- particularly Inspector Brimmer's "undercover operation" has been a complete travesty.

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Just hold on a god damn minute. I...

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: You're Judge right? We need to talk.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: I don't know you and I got nothing to say to you.

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Yeah you do. It's up to you either here or downtown.

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: So... we understand each other Judge?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: I expect to hear from you soon. If Huey Newton takes a crap, I want to know how big it was. Otherwise I'm gonna come looking for you. And I won't be as "friendly" as today.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: I got you.

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Why didn't you tell us about the party you boys were planning at the capitol?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Shit man. It was... you know spontaneous.

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Spontaneous my ass!! You told the press and you don't tell me. Remember you're working for us.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah... whatever you say.

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Are you fucking with me? You smartass piece of shit...

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Get out of the car.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: What's with you?

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Get out of the fucking car.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: What are you crazy?

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Do you know how easy it would be for you to just disappear. Shit, you wouldn't even wash up for weeks. Do you fucking understand?  I want you to move your ass outta neutral. I want a bunch of Panthers served up on a fucking plate. I want you to set 'em up... armed robbery!!

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: I can't... they don't operate that way...

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Fuck how they operate. Just do it. like your man says, "By any means necessary."

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Inspector Brimmer

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah, it's me.

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Judge, hold on, is your phone safe?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Who fucking cares? You cops killed Cy. And before you bastards kill anyone else, I'll give you your fucking set up. That make you happy??!!

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Judge, calm down.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Hey... what the hell you doing?

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Shut up. Just shut the fuck up.

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Go! Run! Go on! Get the fuck out of here!!

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: What? So you can shoot me? Call it resisting arrest?

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: I ain't gonna shoot you Judge. Look... it's over. Just run away. Get out. Stay away from Oakland. Cause it's gone... it's gone.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Brimmer you're fucked up...

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Yeah... I'm fucked up. You're fucked up. Government's fucked up. Whole country's fucked up. You got no idea what's going on here. This is bigger than you and me. We're just little tiny soldiers getting moved around on some big asshole's desk. The Panthers... fuck you're history... they killed you and you don't even know it.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Who's they?

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: Drugs Judge, they're gonna flood West Oakland with dope. Jack you up and string you out like a two dollar whore. And while the community's shuffling for a fix, they're gonna snuff every Panther they can find.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Who? I mean besides the FBI?

turns.speaker: BRIMMER
turns.text: I don't know. Except, it's one of you. Maybe not a Panther, but it's someone from the neighborhood. Judge. Look, just go. Get away. It's over. You lost.  We all lost.
